alert.note: Alert for Loup Rivers Basin (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued October 12 at 3:11AM CDT until October 12 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW HUMIDITY FOR PORTIONS OF NORTH CENTRAL NEBRASKA... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW HUMIDITY FOR PORTIONS OF NORTH CENTRAL NEBRASKA... The National Weather Service in North Platte has issued a Red Flag Warning for strong winds and low humidity, which is in effect from noon today to 8 PM CDT this evening. A Fire Weather Watch has also been issued. This Fire Weather Watch for strong winds and low humidity is in effect from Thursday afternoon through Thursday evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zone 209 Loup Rivers Basin. * TIMING...This afternoon and evening. * WINDS...Northwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 19 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the lower 50s. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly and be very difficult to control.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
